wikipedia_page.main: Richard Hugh Britnell  (21 April 1944, in Wrexham – 17 December 2013) was Professor (later Professor Emeritus) of the Department of History, University of Durham. An economic historian, his work demonstrated that "commerce played an essential part in medieval life". His obituary in The Guardian stated that "Not many academics can be said to have moved the boundaries of their subject, yet no one meeting Richard encountered any pretension or flamboyance". He was a prolific author.

response: * Richard Britnell – Professor of History at the University of Durham from 1997 to 2003
* Richard Britnell – Emeritus Professor of History at Durham University
*Richard Britnell, 69, British historian.It is with regret that we announce the death of Richard Britnell on Tuesday 17 December 2013
